questions.question_text: Which type of memory is closest to the CPU?
questions.explanation: Cache memory stores frequently accessed data and instructions to speed up CPU operations.

questions.question_text: Which of the following has the largest capacity?
questions.explanation: Hard disks store significantly more data than RAM or cache, but are much slower.

questions.question_text: What is the main purpose of cache memory?
options: To provide high-speed data access to the CPU
questions.correct_answer: To provide high-speed data access to the CPU
questions.explanation: Cache reduces the time needed to access frequently used data, improving performance.

questions.question_text: Which of the following correctly represents the memory hierarchy from fastest to slowest?
questions.explanation: The closer the memory is to the CPU, the faster and more expensive it is.

questions.question_text: What characteristic makes SRAM faster than DRAM?
questions.explanation: Unlike DRAM, SRAM retains data without refresh cycles, making it faster.
